paper_abstract: Ray intersection graphs are intersection graphs of rays, or halflines, in the plane. We show that any planar graph has an even subdivision whose complement is a ray intersection graph. The construction can be done in polynomial time and implies that finding a maximum clique in a segment intersection graph is NP-hard. This solves a 21-year old open problem posed by Kratochvil and NeetA (TM) il (Comment Math Univ Carolinae 31(1):85-93, 1990).
paper_title: The Clique Problem in Ray Intersection Graphs
